predefined_profiles.name: Wang Yong
predefined_profiles.public profile: Wang Yong is a third-year college student. During the summer vacation, his university organized a volunteer activity to help elderly people in the deep mountains. Being always proactive, he signed up and became a volunteer. Wang Yong's appearance is quite ordinary, and he is not particularly tall, but he has a strong passion for helping others. He consistently ranks at the top of his class and is also the president of the school's detective club, possessing a great deal of personal charm.
predefined_profiles.goal: Uncover the truth about the village and survive the volunteer activity.
predefined_profiles.private profile: Wang Yong aims to earn the title of Best Volunteer during the volunteer activity.

predefined_profiles.name: Li Jie
predefined_profiles.public profile: Old Li is Wang Yong's best friend and also his roommate. He is an athlete known for his excellent running skills and strong build. Li Jie is enthusiastic and cheerful. He has participated in many volunteer activities, and this one to help the elderly in the deep mountains was an event he and Wang Yong agreed to join together.
predefined_profiles.goal: Help the elderly in the deep mountains and complete the volunteer activity.
predefined_profiles.private profile: Li Jie hopes to surpass Wang Yong in academic performance this semester.

scenario: A bus full of volunteers heads to the mountains to help the elderly. Midway, the bus breaks down, and some volunteers inadvertently discover other secrets hidden in the village. Among these volunteers is the protagonist Wang Yong. To uncover the village's secrets, Wang Yong must make the right choices, discover the truth about the village, and strive to survive during the exploration.

dialog.content: .A busload of volunteers is on their way to the deep mountains to help the elderly. Midway, the bus breaks down, and some volunteers accidentally learn of other secrets hidden in the village. The protagonist, Wang Yong, is among these volunteers, and to uncover the village's secrets, Wang Yong must make the right choices, discover the truth of the village, and strive to survive during the exploration.

(As the time for volunteering arrives, Wang Yong and a group of people take a bus to a village deep in the mountains for a volunteer activity. Everyone on the bus is chatting happily and plans to arrive by evening. However, soon after entering the mountainous region in the afternoon and before reaching the destination, the bus suddenly stops. Wang Yong, sitting in the back row) What's going on? Why did the bus stop?
(Hurries off the bus to check) Everyone, don't worry! It looks like there's a problem with the bus.

(Amidst the clamor in the bus, the deep mountains become a little eerie as night approaches) Oh no, if it's night in these mountains, it's really scary. Aren't we close to the village? If we take the back roads, we should reach the village before dark. It's much safer there; being in these mountains at night is really frightening. Old Wang, what do you think? Should we get off and walk there?

content.content: Old Li, but the driver just mentioned that if it can't be fixed today, a support team will come tomorrow, and then we'll be able to switch buses, so he instructed us not to get off. I'm going to follow the driver's plan; if he says to stay, then we'll stay.

question: #question# What should Wang Yong do to demonstrate his adherence to rules?

content.content: Walking sounds great; my backside is sore from sitting. A stroll in the mountains seems pretty exciting. Let's hurry up; I can't wait!
Everyone knows how slow things run at our school. Who knows, the support bus might not come for two days, so walking might be faster.

Old Li, maybe we shouldn't get off. It feels safer on the bus. But then again, we might all just end up stuck here. By chance, I've never walked in the mountains, so it might be a good experience. Let's all go together.

I think we should go for it. We don't have much time, and who knows what might happen or what emergencies could arise in these deep forests by night. I'll grab some handy tools and make sure we reach the village by dark!

question: #question# How should Wang Yong organize everyone in such a difficult situation?

content.content: (Hesitant) Did the driver say how long it will take to fix? Maybe we should wait a bit. It might be fixed soon, and if not, we can walk.
(Reluctant) Huh? But walking is tiring. Do you all really know the way? If it's too far, Iâ€™ll find it too exhausting.
Perhaps we could all go and reach the village before it gets dark. But Old Li, you're being a bit too smart for your own good; it's our first time here. How do we know the exact route?

dialog.content: Oh, alright then. I wanted to get off the bus and go, but since I want to be with you, I'll just stick with you no matter what.
Okay, thank you! This is probably the safest option.

(Being quite playful, couldn't hold it any longer and got off the bus with a few guys to roam around for a bit) Hey, everyone, look! We found a locked cabin up ahead, and there's a well at the entrance. We got some water, it's really sweet. We've brought back a few bowls for everyone to try!
(Wang Yong, having a phobia of germs, politely declined) I feel like I need to use the restroom, so I can't drink anymore. Thanks though.
Alright, I love it, I've had my fill. It's getting late, so let's just make do and sleep on the bus.
Sure, it's so quiet in the mountains, it makes you want to sleep.

(Hearing strange noises deep into the night, quickly shakes Wang Yong awake) Old Wang, don't sleep! Look, the students in the front row have all stood up in strange poses! Could they be zombies? Quickly, what should we do?

content.content: (A sudden idea strikes) Got it! The bus door is locked, but we can jump out the window. We mustn't disturb others, as there might be more zombies that haven't woken yet. Good thing I'm quick-witted!

question: #question# What new idea does Wang Yong always come up with in a crisis?

content.content: (Groggily blinks open his eyes) Old Li, I'm not even stressed recently. How could I be hallucinating? I must have slept to the point of confusion, and my eyes are playing tricks on me, seeing zombies. Let's sleep a bit longer.
That's hilarious! This classmate probably just needs to use the toilet at night. Just the way they walk is bizarre, like a zombie.
(Suddenly shouts) Zombies! Quick, wake everyone up! Everyone wake up, there are zombies, help!
(Wang Yong tries his best not to panic or act on impulse, taking a couple of deep breaths, suddenly thinks of a scene from a horror movie) We need to stay calm! I know, hold your breath!

question: #question# How does Wang Yong regulate the impulsive behavior brought on by his emotions?

content.content: (Wishing he could shake the person next to him awake) Wake up, wake up, zombies, there are zombies! Those who are scared should breathe deeply, don't get scared to death before being bitten.
(Completely breaks down) We've encountered zombies! It's over, with the bus door tightly locked, we're doomed!
(Squinting) Old Li, are you seriously that tired? You're seeing things. It's so funny, how can there be zombies?

dialog.content: (Wang Yong and Li Jie were just thinking about jumping out of the car, completely unaware of what was happening outside) What?! Why is there a pack of vicious dogs crouching outside the car? Ahhhhh, dogs...
As soon as Wang Yong and Li Jie jumped out, the vicious dogs pounced and bit their necks. They had no way to break free and were killed by the dogs.

(Li Jie has already mutated) Holding your breath? You think we can't smell the scent wafting off your skin? That's blood, and it smells delicious. (With that, Li Jie pressed Wang Yong down and bit into his neck)

Wang Yong realized that holding his breath was futile; Li Jie had also become a zombie. The well water was contaminated, turning everyone who drank it into zombies. Li Jie's physique was larger than Wang Yong's, making it impossible for him to break free. Ultimately, he too was bitten and became a zombie.
Those staying behind, we're heading out first. Let's meet at our village. Everyone going, have you got all the essentials? Let's move!

profile.name: Ma Chao
profile.public profile: Wang Yong's classmate, Ma Chao grew up in the mountains and loves hiking. He is very fit but tends to be a know-it-all.
profile.goal: Participate in volunteer activities and get a scholarship.

dialog.content: I'm familiar with the mountain paths and know some shortcuts. Let me lead, we'll get there faster.
(A group starts moving, and after a while, Wang Yong notices something amiss and approaches Ma Chao) How strange, I feel like the surrounding trees are getting taller. What's going on?
(stammering) Uh, this... I find it strange too, this.....
(frowning) Ma Chao! Didn't you know the way?
(Li Jie catches up) Old Wang, what's wrong, did something happen?
(sighing) We're lost. Ma Chao doesn't know the way. We probably won't make it; we might have to stay here in the deep mountains.
(utterly shocked) What?! Ma Chao, damn it, you tricked us...

(Wang Yong quickly stops Li Jie, who is about to get physical, as the sunlight through the leaves grows dimmer) It's getting dark soon. Should we keep going? I'm worried we might disturb something in the deep mountains. Besides, we don't know where to go. Should we wait until tomorrow when it's light to find our way?

(Li Jie feels Wang Yong's suggestion makes sense and calls to everyone) Everybody!! We're lost, and it's getting dark; we won't make it to the village for safety's sake. Let's rest here and look for the way tomorrow.
Everyone, be careful, form small groups and look after each other.

(Just as he is about to find a place to sit down, he looks up) What the... there's a little girl in a red dress squatting there crying in the deep forest. That's so creepy. Old Wang, did you see her? What should we do?

content.content: (Although seeing a little girl in the deep mountains is dangerous, Wang Yong holds back his impulse because it's too strange. But he's not the only one seeing her; his companions see her too and call out to the girl) Hey, I understand everyone's eagerness to save her, but we must be cautious and not act rashly. Be careful, everyone!

question: #question# What should Wang Yong do when he sees the little girl but is unsure of the situation around him to show he is restraining his impulse?

content.content: (startled and shouts out loud) Oh man, in this deep mountain, all the dangerous buffs are stacked! Is she a human or a ghost?
(runs away immediately, shouting) Everyone, don't look, run! This place really has something unclean, it's terrifying!
Whatever, she's just a little girl! It's too dangerous for her here. Saving her is the most important. I have to go rescue her right now!
It's too dangerous for a little girl to be here alone in the deep forest. How could I, Wang Yong, ignore her? Little girl, why are you here by yourself? Do you need help with something?

question: #question# Given Wang Yong's usual strong sense of social responsibility, what would he do? #skill#Responsibility Management

content.content: (rubbing his eyes) Hey, Old Li, am I seeing things, or is that a little girl in red standing over there?
Oh my gosh! A red dress, isnâ€™t that what a ghost girl would wear? That's so creepy.
Little kid, what's wrong? Are you here by yourself? Do you need help, or were you sent to lure us into a trap? If it's the latter, no way.

dialog.content: This little kid's pretty brave, didn't even run away. Hey, little girl, why are you out here alone in the mountains at night? Aren't you scared?

profile.name: Hao Yun
profile.public profile: Hao Yun is a girl from a mountain village. When the zombie virus broke out, her father sacrificed himself to get Hao Yun out safely, but he didn't escape. To avoid zombie attacks, Hao Yun has been surviving in the mountains ever since, and she knows the village's secret.
profile.goal: To reveal the village's secret to the public as long as she remains safe.

dialog.content: (The little girl takes a long time to answer) My name is Hao Yun. I'm from the nearby village. Everyone in the village was fine at first, but after dinner, they all went crazy and started attacking others. My dad helped me escape, but unfortunately, he was left behind in the village.
(Everyone feels a sense of fear after hearing this) What a creepy situation. If what this little girl says is true, then we shouldn't head to the village.
Do you really believe it? But what if what the little girl says isn't true?
It's a bit strange, so let's stay calm. Either way, before we take any action, we should fill our stomachs since most of our food is back in the car. We need energy to face any situation.
I know there's a stream nearby. There might be some food there.
Alright! That makes sense. Let's go find some food! But, Old Wang, what should we do next?

content.content: (Wang Yong considers the known information and the new info from the little girl) We're lost, and there's something strange in the village. I think we should return to the car tomorrow and tell everyone what happened, then devise a plan together.

question: #question# How can Wang Yong demonstrate that he can effectively process and apply the new information from the little girl?

content.content: (Staring blankly in fear) What do we do, what do we do? I'm just a college student, why do I have to face this stuff? Am I going to die here?
You can still eat? You really have nerves of steel. I have no mood at all; I feel like my soul's been lost. Aren't you scared at all?
(A bit skeptical of the girl, thinking she's scaring everyone) Oh, come on, don't be afraid, guys. We live in a society governed by law; there shouldn't be any big problem. Let's just carry on.

There's something strange in the village. Since we're volunteers, why not go see what's going on? After all, we're here to help people in the mountains, so let's continue to figure out what's happening and follow the little girl to the village tomorrow to carry out my mission.

question: #question# How can Wang Yong demonstrate that he remembers his task as a volunteer and insist on exploring the village's secret?

content.content: I'm really crazy! Given the situation now, why even think about other things? I shouldn't care about the village or anything else. Surviving is most important!
(Approaches to ask Li Jie) Old Li, Old Li, what are we doing tomorrow? Should we go back or continue forward?
(Cheerful) Yay, yay, there's food in the stream. Let's fill up first, then we'll have the strength to discuss it further. Anything else is off my mind.

dialog.content: (Soon everyone arrived at the creek, and a few energetic companions started to gear up, while the two Northeastern alumni began to bicker again) Don't just think I'm handsome, I'm also a master angler! I'm a fishing expert!
(provocatively) Old Zhou, is that a spear in my backpack? Hahaha, let's see who catches more!
You! That's cheating!
(Wang Yong did not join them in fishing, choosing instead to observe the surroundings) Wait, why are there traces of a large creature here? Oh no! You two catching fish, be careful!
(Wang Yong was ultimately a step too late, as the smell of blood spread) Ahhhhhhh....
Everyone be careful, there's a large creature nearby, a bear! One of our companions has already encountered peril!
(The companions were all terrified, especially a few of the girls) What? What should we do? It's already very late; isn't traveling at night more dangerous? Would staying here be safer?

content.content: Traveling certainly is too dangerous; it's better to stick with the group. I'm willing to stay here so we can look out for each other.

question: #question#How can Wang Yong demonstrate his emphasis on teamwork to face the potential threat of bears and achieve a common goal?#skill#Teamwork Skill

content.content: I just saw that terrifying scene with my own eyes. Do you not believe me? Do you want to stay here and wait to be eaten? I don't want to stay here!
(breaking down) Are you all fools? If you don't run, I will! There's still a chance to survive if we run now; staying here is a death trap!
(grabbing his backpack and starting to run) I'm out of here; I'm too scared! I'm not sticking around with everyone; do as you please.

I'm eager to learn about the village, and since the creek already had a bear earlier, itâ€™s not safe to stay here. You all stay here; I'm going to leave and continue seeking the village and uncover the secrets hidden in this remote area.

question: #question#How can Wang Yong demonstrate his determination to pursue the goal of uncovering the village's secrets?

content.content: (Got scared) Okay, the incident at the creek really frightened me. I'll stick with the group instead; this way, we can look out for each other.
Many hands make light work; strength lies in numbers. Going on my own is way too dangerous, so I'd better stay here and not act rashly.
Old Li, do you really want to stay here? I don't want to. How about you come with me? We could look after each other and be less conspicuous.

dialog.content: (After speaking, everyone rests on the spot) Lao Zhou, give me some food. I thought we'd reach the village quickly, so I didn't bring any. I'm starving!
Hmph, hope you remember this next time!
(Takes the food) Wait a minute, Lao Wang, did you hear that? What's making that noise?
Sounds like a bear growling! Run!
(The companions have already run off in fear, only a little girl is left frozen in place) The bear's coming, Lao Wang! That little girl's in danger, what do we do?

content.content: As long as there's life, there's hope. Nothing is more important than staying alive. I see her, but we're not related. Best to run and avoid being chased by the bear!

question: #question#With Wang Yong steadfastly protecting his own life, how will he choose?

content.content: I can't be cold-blooded; that's a living being. My morals won't let me abandon my fellow human in their time of need.
Whether I live or die doesn't matter. If I can save even one person from this bear, it's worth it. It'd be awful if everyone perished!
(Unable to bear it) What to do, what to do? Can I really just stand by and watch? If I don't save that little girl, I'll live in regret forever.

I can't just walk away, my conscience won't allow it. When did I become someone who stands by and does nothing? I have to save the little girl. Hao Yun, be careful! The bear's heading this way, run towards me!

question: #question#As a kind and morally responsible person, how will Wang Yong make a choice in this dilemma?

content.content: I'm about to be finished myself, who's going to help me? Whoever wants to save her, go ahead. I need to save my own skin first!
(Calling out to Li Jie, who's already running) Li Jie, I think we can't abandon the little girl. You go save her, I'm retreating for now.
(Hesitant) Oh man, should I save her or not? It seems possible, but I'm really scared. If I fail to save her, I'm doomed too.

dialog.content: (Using his physical fitness, Wang Yong quickly caught up with the faster-running companions ahead) Wang Yong, run fast! This bear is way too aggressive!
I know, those who ran slower have already fallen under the bear's paw, and that little girl was smacked to death by the bear too.
Damn, this is way too terrifying!

(The bear glanced at Wang Yong and the others, but they were too far away, so it didn't pursue them further, turning instead to feed on the fallen humans, leaving everyone scared stiff) Now without the little girl to guide us, which way do we go?
Without the little girl's guidance, Wang Yong and his group wandered aimlessly through the jungle like headless chickens, ultimately getting trapped and perishing in the forest...
(The two successfully reunite, and Wang Yong holding the little girl starts to run) I'm sorry, I think I'm a bit heavy; if you can't manage, just let me go.
No worries, I have companions who are slower runners than me, which also slowed down the bear, although those companions faced a grim fate.
(Once they are safe, Wang Yong puts the little girl down, her tears soaking his garment, she speaks with a tremble in her voice) Thank you, thank you!

(Wang Yong consoles the little girl while sneaking a look at the bear they just encountered, hearing its angry roar, the rest of them decide it's safer to move further away) If we go farther, where can we go? Where to?
I have a secret base we can go to, if you're willing, follow me.
Really? That's great! Let's go then.
My secret base is a small wooden house, and there's a well outside where we've been drawing water before.

(This implies the village is not far, Li Jie sharply recalls what the little girl mentioned before, and loudly questions) You said before there were monsters randomly attacking people in the village, is this place really safe?
(The little girl is noticeably frightened and hides behind Wang Yong, who reassures her to speak up) No, it's a fair distance from the village.
Alright, I'll trust you for now, but letâ€™s first address the issue of food and drink. It seems there's well water here and water inside the house, which should we drink?

content.content: (Sighs in relief) Everyone, don't be too tense; the situation is quite optimistic now. It doesn't matter where the water is from, as long as it quenches our thirst. Well water, straight from nature, is sweet and definitely fine.

question: #question# How would Wang Yong exhibit his optimistic attitude when choosing to drink spring water?

content.content: This is a terrifying deep mountain jungle; everything inside, including the water, is scary. None of us should drink unless someone wants to volunteer as a test subject.
(Doubtfully) Is it really drinkable? I'm a bit scared to try. Maybe someone should taste it first to avoid any mishaps, so we all know how to deal with it.

(Turns to Li Jie) Don't worry, folks, this girl has survived alone for so long; she definitely won't deceive us. Old Li, you try the water inside the house first. Your stomach can handle it, and if there's a problem, it'll become apparent.

(Sees everyone is at a loss on which water to drink, Wang Yong makes up his mind) Ahem, listen up, everyoneâ€”I think the little girl brought us here to help, surely she wouldn't harm us. I believe the water inside the house is safe, but I can't say the same for the well. So if you trust me, join me in drinking the water from the house!

question: #question# How does Wang Yong lead everyone?

content.content: Just do whatever you feel like, drink whatever you want, it's all water anyway. At this point, are we still afraid of something as simple as water?
(Fearful and despairing, ready to give up) Do you really believe we can escape? Even if we're well-fed and hydrated, can we really get out of here? Where are we even now?
(Turns sincerely to Hao Yun) Hao Yun, they're both drinkable, right? There's no issue with the well water or the house water, is there? Which do you recommend?

dialog.content: Come on, everyone, let's go to the well and fetch some water. Let's try to get as much as we can.
(Everyone successfully fetched the well water and distributed it) Thanks for the water, Old Li. Hao Yun, do you want some?
(Hao Yun, still shaken, feels a bit parched) Yes, thank you!

After tidying up, everyone went to rest. Just as dawn was breaking, Hao Yun, feebly whispered into Wang Yong's ear that there seemed to be something wrong with the well water, but by then, Wang Yong had already lost consciousness. It turned out the well water was contaminated, and those who drank it turned into zombies.
(After hearing Wang Yong's speech, everyone thinks it makes sense) Alright, since that's the case, let's go inside and have some water!
Some of us think the well water is cleaner, so we're going to get some well water to drink.

(In the end, everyone falls asleep reluctantly, hungry, and Wang Yong is groggily awakened by a little girl) Look at those people who drank the well water, what's going on there? And those people outside the house?
Ah, what's happening? Are they even human anymore? Their stance is so exaggerated, and why are they growling? Old Li, wake up, something's wrong! We have to run!
(But then there is a huge crashing sound from outside) It's a bear, the bear is coming, follow me this way, through the back door!
(Wang Yong signals to those who can move to follow him) Everybody, over here! Hao Yun has a plan!
(As the girl leads the way towards the village, the roar of a bus engine is heard nearby) Old Wang, it's the bus! The bus is fixed and made it to the village, let's hurry and get on it.
(Staring hard at Wang Yong) Quickly, come with me! Nobody move, follow me!
(Puzzled) Old Wang, are we going with this little girl? What are we supposed to do?

content.content: On further thought, heading to the bus seems like the safest option, and we can explain the situation to those on the bus. Hao Yun, the current situation makes running around the jungle very dangerous, who knows what other beasts might appear? Let's all head to the bus and escape from here!

question: #question# How did Wang Yong decide to head to the bus after thinking it through?

content.content: (Hesitantly) What should I do? Another one of these choices, which one is right? Let's just go to the bus. My gut feeling is that it's the safer option. Hao Yun, stop talking, we're going to the bus. You're welcome to join us or not.

(Plucks a small flower next to him) Let's leave it to fate, I'll pick the petals: one is the bus, two is Hao Yun, one, two, one, two... No, Hao Yun, you have to tell me why we shouldn't go to the bus, what's the reason? You need to explain clearly so we can follow your suggestion. This place is too terrifying, you need to tell me why not to go to the bus and convince me. Quick.

Old Li, you decide, I can't choose. I don't want to be responsible for so many lives. If I choose wrong, I'm done for, and I'll never forgive myself. Hao Yun has no reason for stopping us from taking the bus, you should ask him when you make a decision.

(Firmly to Hao Yun) I've saved your life once, and you've saved mine in return, that's a bond of life and death. I choose to trust you, Hao Yun! Besides, I want to explore the secrets of this village further, you definitely know more. I'll follow you!
In this situation, I can't trust anyone; I can only trust myself. I want to choose to go to the bus.
I always do things based on feel, so others rarely influence me. Hao Yun's gesture doesn't make a difference.
(Despairing) Why is it another choice? Hao Yun, you kid, giving me multiple choice questions again, my head's really spinning. Old Li, you decide, I'll follow your lead.

question: #question# Wang Yong trusts Hao Yun and sees his sincerity, what will he do?

content.content: (Gives Hao Yun a sideways glance) You're trying to trick me, aren't you? The chance for survival is right there, why won't you let me go? Is this all your conspiracy?

Hao Yun, right now I have no reason to trust you. After all, we were strangers before, no family ties. I'm thankful for the chance encounter we had, but you haven't really explained why we shouldn't take the bus. I have to be responsible for my team, we're going on our own now, but thank you anyway, and be careful.

(Upon seeing the bus, he seemingly finds hope and grabs the little girl) Hao Yun, come with me, it's much safer on the bus. If anything happens, we'll look for the police! You said not to take the bus, but right now it's obviously the safest place, and you haven't clearly explained why not. But I care about your safety, so I'm taking you on the bus with me.

dialog.content: (shakes his head) Forget it, you guys go on. I'm a part of this place, I have to stay here.
(the teammates had already run towards the coach) Alright then, until we meet again.

(the area around the bus is noisy, zombies have already surrounded the vehicle) Oh man, what are we going to do? The bus canâ€™t move at all, but luckily those zombies can't get inside. Let's think about how we can get in.
Wait for the right moment. Oh shoot, Lao Li, look over there, why is there a pack of dogs running this way? Where did they come from? Run!

Part of the pack ran towards the bus, while others charged at Wang Yong. Wang Yong ultimately didnâ€™t make it onto the bus; after killing two dogs, he was ambushed and bitten by others. In his unwillingness, he slowly lost consciousness. By the time he regained awareness, he had fully turned into a zombie. These dogs carried the zombie toxin, and not one of these volunteers survived.
They all chose to go to the bus, but I trusted you guys and followed you two. You have to keep me safe!
I'm taking you to another secret base of mine now. There's some food and water there, enough to fill your stomachs.
We got here in less than ten minutes! Wow, there really is food. I was starving, finally, I can have a full meal!
(giving Wang Yong a look) Come with me to the second floor, I'll show you the secret you want to know.

(Upon reaching the second floor, Wang Yong is stunned, seeing the situation inside the village. The village is basically a zombie nest. It turns out someone has been experimenting on zombies at the cost of others, and they were just the latest batch of victims to be deceived) What a bunch of monsters!

Wang Yong uncovered the village's secret and discovered the truth about the village. With Hao Yun's help, they managed to escape the deep mountains, immediately reported to the authorities, and waited for the culprits to be brought to justice!
(A few companions tried to persuade Wang Yong before he left, but he was determined to go) Alright, Old Wang, be careful on your way, watch out, watch out, and then watch out again!
Hao Yun, can you tell me the way to the village? Which direction is it roughly?
(Pointing in a direction) Just keep going straight that way, but seriously, be careful!

(After saying goodbye, Wang Yong found himself wandering for what seemed like forever. Just as the sky began to lighten, he stumbled upon the village) Thinking of what the little girl said about the strange happenings, I suddenly feel a bit scared. Is it too late to turn back? Whatâ€™s this? Where did this dog come from? Itâ€™s such a creepy dog, and why doesn't it bark?

In his panic, Wang Yong quickly took out a knife from his bag, but the dog wasn't afraid and lunged at him. Wang Yong swung his knife several times but missed each time. Meanwhile, he heard the sound of many footsteps approaching from the village. The people making the footsteps revealed their true natureâ€”zombies. What the little girl said was true. In this chaotic situation, Wang Yong was ultimately ambushed and bitten to death by the zombie dog.

(As Wang Yong shared his thoughts on the way to the creek, everyone unexpectedly agreed unanimously) I've just come up with a new idea, how about we set off right now? Actually, we aren't that hungry, and once we find the village, everything will be sorted!
(Suddenly appeared from nowhere) I think it's a good idea, after all, being without a place to settle down in these deep mountains is really scary.
Old Wang, since everyone thinks it's a good idea, what do you think about departing now?

content.content: (Wang Yong turned to see the little girl shaking her head slightly, indicating no) Quiet down, friends, I donâ€™t think itâ€™s a good idea. Listen to me, setting off now is too dangerous. There are too many unknown factors in the dark, plus we havenâ€™t eaten yet. If there really are strange occurrences in the village, weâ€™d be too starved to even run away, so letâ€™s wait until morning to leave!

question: #question# How can Wang Yong demonstrate his ability to present compelling arguments to persuade everyone to leave in the morning despite their decision to depart immediately at night?

content.content: Young people should be bold, why hesitate and waver? Are we really going to be influenced by a little girlâ€™s moods? Let's set off immediately!

Hao Yun knows the village situation best, and we should respect his opinion. Besides, we only have one life, and we must treat it carefully. We should report back to a higher authority to handle this. But it seems everyone has decided to leave now, my decision is quite insignificant, so I'll just go with everyone and set off now.
(Cheering himself on) Wang Yong, don't be indecisive! Hesitation will lead to failure. Be decisive and march straight to the village with all your might!

(Seeing everyone's high spirits, Wang Yong was also invigorated and thought it feasible, but the little girl seemed not very keen) Hao Yun, you might not understand why your elder siblings want to do this now, but it's all to find the village quickly, figure out what's happening there according to what you said, and help the people in the village. Then we can all have a sound sleep, and you can finally go home!

question: #question# How can Wang Yong effectively convey to the little girl that everyone wants to set off immediately?

content.content: Little sister Hao Yun, you seem to disagree. Don't be afraid, we will protect you. We are volunteers here to find out whatâ€™s happening in the village, and weâ€™ll help restore everything to normal. Trust us, you have to come with us, whether you want to or not. We're here to help you, you have to lead the way.
(Pulls out a knife from his backpack and holds it to the little girlâ€™s neck) Hao Yun, we are leaving immediately, lead the way!
Old Li, what should we do, the little girl disagrees. Go and explain our intentions to her, I'm not good with words, you go quickly.

dialog.content: Indeed, everyone, I was a bit careless. Old Wang really thought it through.
(After finding some food and drinks by the creek, everyone rested.) It's dawn, folks. Let's head out early. The village isn't too far ahead.
(In less than an hour) This is great, we've finally reached the village!
Let's not go in yet; let's observe from outside. Better be safe!
(However, after a long observation, nobody came out of the village. Wang Yong felt something was off, and a sense of foreboding struck him.) Damn it! We were too careless. Everyone, get out of here!

It was too late. Wang Yong and his group, not bothering to conceal themselves, had inadvertently stirred things up. They were spotted from the village, surrounded from behind, and unable to escape, they were all captured and turned into zombies!
(Sighs after listening) Since you're so eager to go, I can take you there. But once we reach the village, I won't go in with you. I need to leave first.
That's the spirit, everyone together. Alright, alright, lead the way!
(Arriving quickly at the village) Here we are. I've brought you to the village, now I'm off.
Ah, you're not going in? It looks pretty normal to me. Well then, take care on the road. Let's go, everyone. Let's head to the entrance and take a look.

At the village entrance, Wang Yong pushed open the village gate and was stunned by what he saw. There were dozens of zombies at the entrance, and before anyone could react, they lunged at them. Wang Yong, who was at the front, was the first to be caught and bitten, turning into a zombie.
(comforting the frightened little girl) Yes, this is way too dangerous. Donâ€™t be scared, tell us brothers whatâ€™s happening?
(the little girl didnâ€™t answer and suddenly turned around and ran away) Hey, why is the little girl running? Ah! A bear! Turns out thereâ€™s a bear behind us, run!

(how could there be a bear, Wang Yongâ€™s mind froze, and when he finally reacted and started to run, he didnâ€™t pay attention to his feet and suddenly tripped and sprained his ankle) Ahhhh, my foot! It hurts so much, Iâ€™m done for!
As expected, Wang Yong was caught by the bear. He still wanted to help the little girl, but didnâ€™t expect to fall himself. The bear swatted Wang Yong and he was killed instantly.
